Alexandrite.Name: Alexandrite
Alexandrite.Description: Displays a color change dependent upon the nature of ambient lighting.

AmmoliteNode.Name: Ammolite Node
AmmoliteNode.Description: This stone is rich in gems.

Ammolite.Name: Ammolite
Ammolite.Description: An opal-like organic gemstone known for its dragon-like texture.

ApatiteNode.Name: Apatite Node
ApatiteNode.Description: This stone is rich in gems.

Apatite.Name: Apatite
Apatite.Description: Very common as an accessory mineral in igneous and metamorphic rocks, where it is the most common phosphate mineral.

Azurite.Name: Azurite
Azurite.Description: A soft, deep-blue copper mineral produced by the weathering of copper ore deposits. During the early 19th century, it was also known as 'Chessylite.'

Bloodstone.Name: Bloodstone
Bloodstone.Description: A heliotrope, also known as a Bloodstone.

BlueZircon.Name: Blue Zircon
BlueZircon.Description: Colorless specimens that show gem quality are a popular substitute for diamond and are also known as 'Matara Diamonds.' Blue variant.

BrownZircon.Name: Brown Zircon
BrownZircon.Description: Colorless specimens that show gem quality are a popular substitute for diamonds and are also known as 'Matara Diamonds.' Brown variant.

Chryzokola.Name: Chryzokola
Chryzokola.Description: The name comes from the ancient Greek 'chrysos' and 'kolla.'

Clinohumite.Name: Clinohumite
Clinohumite.Description: Elegant red gem. Although rare, humite series members occur across the globe.

BlueCoralNode.Name: Blue Coral Node
BlueCoralNode.Description: This stone is rich in coral.

BlueCoral.Name: Blue Coral
BlueCoral.Description: Jewel made by coral. Blue variant.

BrownCoralNode.Name: Brown Coral Node
BrownCoralNode.Description: This stone is rich in coral.

BrownCoral.Name: Brown Coral
BrownCoral.Description: Jewel made by coral. Brown variant.

GreenCoralNode.Name: Green Coral Node
GreenCoralNode.Description: This stone is rich in coral.

GreenCoral.Name: Green Coral
GreenCoral.Description: Jewel made by coral. Green variant.

PurpleCoralNode.Name: Purple Coral Node
PurpleCoralNode.Description: This stone is rich in coral.

PurpleCoral.Name: Purple Coral
PurpleCoral.Description: Jewel made by coral. Purple variant.

CrystalOfLife.Name: Crystal of Life
CrystalOfLife.Description: An incredibly rare crystal found deep, deep in the mines. It is said it posesses the power to bring people back to life.

CrystalOfDeath.Name: Crystal of Death
CrystalOfDeath.Description: An incredibly rare crystal found deep, deep in the mines. It is said it possesses the power to kill others.

CrystalOfLifeAndDeathNode.Name: Crystal of Life and Death Node
CrystalOfLifeAndDeathNode.DisplayName: Crystal of Life and Death Node

CrystalOfLifeAndDeath.Name: Crystal of Life and Death
CrystalOfLifeAndDeath.Description: An incredibly rare crystal found deep, deep within the mines. It is said it possesses the power of controlling life and death.

Danburite.Name: Danburite
Danburite.Description: Its crystal symmetry and form are similar to Topaz.

FireAgate.Name: Fire Agate
FireAgate.Description: Layered gemstone with various precipitated components.

Fluorite.Name: Fluorite
Fluorite.Description: Comes in a wide range of colors and has consequently been dubbed 'the most colorful mineral in the world.'

Labradorite.Name: Labradorite
Labradorite.Description: It is highly prized by collectors for its rarity and for its delicate bluish green color. It is rarely cut because it is fragile and brittle, and large crystals are too valuable to be broken up.

LavaCrystalNode1.Name: Lava Crystal Node
LavaCrystalNode1.Description: A magic ingeous rock formed from rapidly cooling lava.

LavaCrystal.Name: Lava Crystal
LavaCrystal.Description: A beautiful crystal made of crystallized lava. It's really hot, but somehow it doesn't burn anything around it.

LavaCrystalNode2.Name: Lava Crystal Node
LavaCrystalNode2.Description: A magic igneous rock formed from rapidly cooling lava.

MossAgate.Name: Moss Agate
MossAgate.Description: Layered gemstone with various precipitated components.

Phosphophyllite.Name: Phosphophyllite
Phosphophyllite.Description: It is highly prized by collectors for its delicate bluish green color. It is rarely cut because it is fragile and brittle, and large crystals are too valuable to be broken up.

Andesine.Name: Andesine
Andesine.Description: A form of Quartz, characterized by its translucency. Orange variant.

Aventurine.Name: Aventurine
Aventurine.Description: An opal-like organic gemstone known for its dragon-like texture. Green variant of Quartz.

LavenderQuartz.Name: Lavender Quartz
LavenderQuartz.Description: A lavender colored Quartz crytal reminiscent of a rose.

RutilatedQuartz.Name: Rutilated Quartz
RutilatedQuartz.Description: A rutilated crystal reminiscent of a rose. Yellow variant of Quartz.

RedZircon.Name: Red Zircon
RedZircon.Description: Colorless specimens that show gem quality are a popular substitute for diamond and are also known as 'Matara Diamonds.' Red variant.

PurpleSapphire.Name: Purple Sapphire
PurpleSapphire.Description: Purple Sapphire. Definitely different than their typical blue hue.

VioletSapphire.Name: Violet Sapphire
VioletSapphire.Description: Violet Sapphire. Definitely different than their typical blue hue.

GoldTopaz.Name: Gold Topaz
GoldTopaz.Description: Topaz of brilliant coloration, like fireworks. Much rarer than its regular counterpart. Gold variant.

SkyBlueTopaz.Name: Sky Blue Topaz
SkyBlueTopaz.Description: Elegant blue Topaz. Much rarer than its regular counterpart.

YellowTopaz.Name: Yellow Topaz
YellowTopaz.Description: Topaz of brilliant coloration, like fireworks. Much raarer than their regular counterpart.

YellowZircon.Name: Yellow Zircon
YellowZircon.Description: Colorless specimens that show gem quality are a popular substitute for diamond and are also known as 'Matara Diamonds.' Yellow variant.

Zircon.Name: Zircon
Zircon.Description: Colorless specimens that show gem quality are a popular substitute for diamond and are also known as 'Matara Diamonds.' Normal variant.
